patterns: What are the symptoms of covid?
What are the effects of covid?
responses: COVID-19 is a respiratory illness caused by the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2.
Common symptoms include fever, cough, fatigue, and loss of taste or smell.
COVID-19 spreads through respiratory droplets when an infected person coughs or sneezes.
It can affect the lungs and other organs, especially in people with weak immunity.
Wearing a mask, washing hands regularly, and social distancing can help prevent the spread of COVID-19.

patterns: What are the symptoms of COVID-19?
How do I know if I have COVID?
responses: Common symptoms include fever, dry cough, tiredness, and difficulty breathing.

patterns: How can I protect myself from COVID-19?
responses: Wear a mask, maintain social distancing, wash your hands regularly, and avoid crowded places.

patterns: What is the treatment for COVID-19?
Is there a cure for COVID?
responses: Most people recover with rest and supportive care. Severe cases may need hospital treatment. Please consult a doctor.

patterns: Is there a vaccine for COVID-19?
responses: Yes, COVID-19 vaccines are available. It is recommended to get vaccinated to reduce the risk of severe illness.

patterns: Where can I get tested for COVID-19?
How do I test for coronavirus?
responses: You can get tested at nearby government hospitals or authorized labs. Please check your local health department website.
Quarantine usually lasts 5–14 days depending on exposure and symptoms. Follow your local health guidelines.
COVID-19 has several variants like Delta and Omicron. Variants may spread faster, so extra caution is advised.

patterns: Who do I call for help?
responses: You can call the government COVID-19 helpline at 1075 or check your state’s helpline number.
